title: Ticket #2865: [Debian] Basic test suite run for native builds
description:
The Debian build framework can run tests as part of the automated build process. We should provide a formula (ideally a single command) that will run part of the test suite and indicate success or failure, as a basic smoke-test of Condor.

The existing test suite gives us almost everything we need. These issues will probably need to addressed before it's useable by the Debian build system:

  • Test selection: The set of tests we run in the BaTLab is probably too large and time-consuming. We'll want a shorter list.
  • Lingering daemons: batch_test.pl leaves a set of daemons running after it completes. We'll want a mode where nothing is left running after the tests complete.
  • Simple command: It'd be nice if the test suite could run using a simple command, maybe as just a build target.
